prs.title: solana: core bridge initialize script
prs.truncated_body:
The existing rust `bridge_client` does not work with modern Solana runtimes (at least after v2).

These scripts can be used to initialize a new core bridge deployment and test posting a message.

This PR also includes scripts for testing the verify and post message shims.

- Increase failureThreshold to 5 (default: 3) in case the changes are slow to propagate.

increase gas-limit parameter for both calls
bump token bridge funding to 100 ether

prs.title: CRE Operational Events in Engine
prs.truncated_body:
CRE-375

Now that our workflow events have matured, we want to migrate from using BaseMessage with runtime defined KV pairs, to pre-defined KVs in events.proto. 

This uses Beholder as CHiP ingress will be included with Beholder when first shipped (Dual Source)

## Future Considerations
* I kept the domain `platform` instead of migrating to `cre` - we will migrate later on.

prs.title: [DX-375] allow DONs without bootstrap node
prs.truncated_body:
Currently, all DONs aparat from gateway "DON" need to have a bootstrap node, but that doesn't correctly reflect how CRE works. It is fine if various DONs use the same bootstrap node.

In order to reduce scope of changes we now require only the workflow DON to have a bootstrap node and if other DONs don't have it, they will use workflow DON's one. That allows us to reduce other DON sizes by 1.

commits.message: support only 1 bootstrap node across all DONs

prs.title: bump starknet.go & juno
prs.truncated_body:
Bumping to latest starknet.go `v0.8.0`, which supports juno `v0.12.x`, but does not build with latest `v0.14.x`.

This has the side effect of fully removing the erroring `github.com/sourcegraph/sourcegraph/lib` from the transitive dependency tree.

prs.title: Log pruning for Solana LogPoller
prs.truncated_body:
### Description

This adds a `PruneLogs` method to `lp.filters` which gets run by the background worker thread every 10 minutes, just after `PruneFilters` is run. A 9 minute deadline on the context is set, to make sure a previous pruning run never interferes with the next one.

The filters are shuffled randomly and iterated over. This could potentially help in a case where the db is overloaded

prs.truncated_body:
## Description

eth-beacon has custom code to group addresses into batches.
But `@chainlink/external-adapter-framework` has a function for that which is already used right below to group batches into groups.

## Changes

Use `splitArrayIntoChunks` to create batches.

## Steps to Test

Covered by existing [

prs.title: Test request grouping in polkadot-balance
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

The polkadot-balance external adapter batches RPCs but this was not tested.
In other EAs, batching refers to putting multiple addresses in a single RPC and
grouping refers to limiting the number of concurrent RPCs to the group size and waiting for the previous group to complete before initiating the next group of RPCs.
But polkadot-balance does not do this kind of batching and

prs.title: Test request grouping in por-address-list
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

The por-address-list external adapter groups RPCs but this was not tested.
Batching refers to putting multiple addresses in a single RPC. This was already tested.
Grouping refers to limiting the number of concurrent RPCs to the group size and waiting for the previous group to complete before initiating the next group of RPCs. This was not tested.

## Changes

Add unit test

prs.title: Fix off-by-one in por-address-list batch size
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

The `endIndex` of a `getPoRAddressList` call on the `PoRAddressList` [contract interface](https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DEPLOY/pages/590545195/PoR+address+list+interface+proposal) is considered to be **inclusive**.
So when we need to fetch a batch of `batchSize`, we need `endIndex = startIndex + batchSize - 1`.

But the current code in por-address-list ext

commits.message: Fix off-by-one in por-address-list batch size

prs.title: Test request grouping in eth-beacon
prs.truncated_body:
## Description

The `eth-beacon` external adapter batches and groups RPCs but this was not tested.
Batching refers to putting multiple addresses in a single RPC.
Grouping refers to limiting the number of concurrent RPCs to the group size and waiting for the previous group to complete before initiating the next group of RPCs.

## Changes

Add integration tests for batching and grouping.

prs.title: ctb: Remove extra mips address from StandardValidator
prs.truncated_body:
There was both a `mips` and a `mipsImpl` address in the `StandardValidator`, which was causing confusion.

Only one was used, so I deleted `mips` and kept `mipsImpl` because it is consistent with what is [in the OPCM](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/3905129d6f203dba896328306cba521a7c4bd6b4/packages/contracts-bedrock/src/L1/OPContractsManager.sol#L1565).

commits.message: ctb: Remove extra mips address from StandardValidator

prs.title: feat: add semgrep rule for new error format
prs.truncated_body: Adds a new semgrep rule that enforces the error format that we standardized on last year. Everything is currently being added to the ignore list, we'll burn down on fixing the custom errors later but this will prevent new issues from popping up.

commits.message:
feat: add semgrep rule for new error format

Adds a new semgrep rule that enforces the error format that we
standardized on last year. Everything is currently being added to
the ignore list, we'll burn down on fixing the custom errors later
but this will prevent new issues from popping up.

prs.title: op-program: Lint client for err113
prs.truncated_body:
Adds the [`err113`](https://github.com/Djarvur/go-err113) golang-ci linter to CI. At the moment, this linter is only used for the op-program client to minimize the change diff. The linter will be progressively expanded to the rest of the monorepo in future PRs.

### Why?

We've been bitten by critical bugs in the [interop op-program](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/14988)

prs.title: op-supervisor: Recreate Subscription Chan on Retry
prs.truncated_body:
Fixes: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/15103

When starting a new subscription, `m.nodeEvents` is reset to a fresh channel. However, if the subscription fails and needs to be retried, the subscription closes the provided channel. This lead to panic/crashes when a Node would reconnect to the Supervisor, exercising the connection retry.

This fixes the issue by always recrea

prs.title: op-program: Guard reproducible-prestate against invalid embed configs
prs.truncated_body:
The change introduces a `check-custom-chains` subcommand to `configs` that checks that the embedded custom chain configuration looks OK. The check also ensures that all referenced chains in a dependency set are known to the program.

This check is now a requirement to build the reproducible prestate.

prs.title: feat(contracts/solve): implemented gasless orders
prs.truncated_body:
Fully implemented `IERC7683.openFor` and `IERC7683.resolveFor`, and all other associated functions to support gasless orders for users. Also implemented `EIP712` for structured signature verification. `MockSolverNetInbox` now mirrors `SolverNetInbox`, just without ownable functions.

issue: #3604

prs.title: chore(contracts/solve): flipped open events
prs.truncated_body:
Flipping `open` order events to remain backwards compatible with SDK.

issue: none

prs.title: chore(sdk): bump react sdk version
prs.truncated_body:
Bump sdk version.

issue: none

prs.title: fix(sdk): fix open log parsing
prs.truncated_body:
Fix open event logs parsing.

In recent contract change, we added a new event to event log at the end of Inbox.open. Which means we can no longer use the last order as open event.

issue: none

prs.title: chore(sdk): add integration tests for contracts
prs.truncated_body:
The integration tests import the ABIs used in the source of the SDK and ensure they match the JSON files generated by forge.
In CI, these JSON files are always generated before running the tests, so any change should be captured even if the reference files in the integration tests assets folder haven't been updated.

issue: https://github.com/omni-network/omni/issues/3559

commits.message: chore(sdk): add integration tests for contracts

prs.title: @sei-js/cosmjs: Remove dependency on deprecated @sei-js/proto, remove redundant exports, cleaned up building and directory structure
prs.truncated_body:
# @sei-js/cosmos cleanup

- 100% test coverage for `@sei-js/cosmjs`
- Build packages in dependency order (fixes broken tests github action due to building cosmjs before cosmos)
- Remove Query Client as this is redundant with `@sei-js/cosmos/rest`
- Update cosmjs versions
- Update README of package to use /cosmos imports instead of /proto exports
- Refactored "core" directory to be "clients"

commits.message:
Replace @sei-js/proto with @sei-js/cosmos

Updated stargateClient.ts to use new amino and registry imports from @sei-js/cosmos instead of @sei-js/proto

Remove @sei-js/proto dependencies

- Update cosmjs packages
- Remove query client (as this is exported in @sei-js/cosmos)
- Updates types to use @sei-js/cosmos instead of @sei-js/proto
Update main README.md, removed query client from /cosmjs README

@sei-js/cosmjs remove anything not cosmjs related

- Removed CosmosKit as Sei is included in the main cosmos kit registry now
- Removed APR package, will move to @sei-js/cosmos or move to knowledge base/docs
- Updated directory structure of clients
- Update Typedoc comments to be accurate
- Removed any last references to @sei-js/proto
- Removed serialize file as they are either redundant to @cosmjs or wrappers around @sei-js/cosmos functions
- Removed Keplr verification file as this exact export can be found elsewhere in this package

Update install state, remove declaration, add flag to build in dependency order

 --topological-dev is needed to build cosmos before cosmjs for example

prs.title: fix: don't crash for big values
prs.truncated_body:
The BN constructor would crash if `user_mint_user_balance` is too big to warn the user `number` is not precise after a certain magnitude.

This doesn't fix the loss of precision problem, but at least it doesn't crash anymore

prs.title: feat: use sendTransaction for OIS
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Use wallet send transaction for OIS instead of sign and send

## Rationale

For multisig wallets it takes time for everyone to sign and causes block hash to expire.

## How has this been tested?

- [ ] Current tests cover my changes
- [ ] Added new tests
- [ x] Manually tested the code

prs.title: feat(entropy): Add callback failure states to the contract
prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Currently, the Entropy keeper cannot invoke a callback if the underlying callback fails. This creates confusion for users, who can't distinguish between "the keeper is offline" and "my callback code reverts". 

This change creates a failure flow for callbacks that allows the keeper's transaction to succeed while explicitly reporting a failure of the underlying callback. Requests wi

add test for update data with fixture

This is a good test but also a good tool to deserialize update data for troubleshooting. If we get many requests to parse the update data we can add it as an API to Hermes or make a CLI for it but I don't think it's necessary for now.

## How has this been tested?

- [x] Added new tests

prs.title: Add ContractID typedef for improved XDR-JSON
prs.truncated_body:
### What
Add ContractId typedef that wraps the Hash type for hashes holding contract IDs.

### Why
This creates a distinct, more semantic type for contract identifiers, enabling better rendering for XDR-JSON.

Dependent on:
- https://github.com/stellar/stellar-xdr/pull/250
- https://github.com/stellar/stellar-xdr/pull/253

prs.title: Resolves issues 5991 and 5989
prs.truncated_body:
Resolves issues #5991  and #5989 

- adds the merge queue workflow trigger for clippy, so it may be a required status check on future pr's
- disables the release PR workflow when a release is an `-rc`

@obycode

prs.title: fix: ignore `wait_on_interim_blocks`
prs.truncated_body:
The wait that this introduced was there just to ensure that the chains coordinator had time to set the flag to pause the miner before it attempted to mine again. This is now handled instead by waiting for the last block to be processed before proceeding.

To force a longer wait time between blocks, there is already the `min_time_between_blocks_ms` option for this.

Fixes: #5960

commits.message:
fix: ignore `wait_on_interim_blocks`

The wait that this introduced was there just to ensure that the chains
coordinator had time to set the flag to pause the miner before it
attempted to mine again. This is now handled instead by waiting for the
last block to be processed before proceeding.

To force a longer wait time between blocks, there is already the
`min_time_between_blocks_ms` option for this.

fix: wait for block to be processed, not to be tip

It is not certain that the last block we mined will become the canonical
tip, so it is better to just wait for it to be processed.

test: fix `nakamoto_attempt_time` test

Pause the miner iwhen submitting transactions so that all transactions
intended to be in one block will be in the same block.

feat: move `SortitionDB::open` closer to its use

Also change it to not require write access.
chore: fixes for latest clippy checks

fix: revert timestamp change

In practice, this situation is unlikely to happen, since the timestamp
is set before mining begins. Setting it to the parent timestamp + 1
causes problems in some tests that rely on quickly producing blocks.

test: fix `idle_tenure_extend_active_mining`

Removes flakiness from blocks mining too quickly.
refactor: use `div_ceil` in idle time calculation

prs.title: feat: avoid clearing caches when block is successfully mined
prs.truncated_body: This further improves the mempool iteration by avoiding unnecessary resets of the mempool caches. When the block is mined successfully, then the caches are correct and can be kept intact for the building of the next block. My experiments show an additional 10% improvement in the time to process large mempools with this change.

commits.message: feat: avoid clearing caches when block is successfully mined
test: verify nonce cache in integration test

prs.title: ci: reduce test flakiness (CI is so slow)
prs.truncated_body: I noticed that sometimes the miner's 5 seconds runs out before it has time to include 5000 transactions in the block, triggering a failure.

commits.message: ci: reduce test flakiness (CI is so slow)

prs.title: Resolves issues 5991 and 5989
prs.truncated_body:
Resolves issues #5991  and #5989 

- adds the merge queue workflow trigger for clippy, so it may be a required status check on future pr's
- disables the release PR workflow when a release is an `-rc`

@obycode

prs.title: fix: ignore `wait_on_interim_blocks`
prs.truncated_body:
The wait that this introduced was there just to ensure that the chains coordinator had time to set the flag to pause the miner before it attempted to mine again. This is now handled instead by waiting for the last block to be processed before proceeding.

To force a longer wait time between blocks, there is already the `min_time_between_blocks_ms` option for this.

Fixes: #5960

commits.message:
fix: ignore `wait_on_interim_blocks`

The wait that this introduced was there just to ensure that the chains
coordinator had time to set the flag to pause the miner before it
attempted to mine again. This is now handled instead by waiting for the
last block to be processed before proceeding.

To force a longer wait time between blocks, there is already the
`min_time_between_blocks_ms` option for this.

fix: wait for block to be processed, not to be tip

It is not certain that the last block we mined will become the canonical
tip, so it is better to just wait for it to be processed.

test: fix `nakamoto_attempt_time` test

Pause the miner iwhen submitting transactions so that all transactions
intended to be in one block will be in the same block.

feat: move `SortitionDB::open` closer to its use

Also change it to not require write access.
chore: fixes for latest clippy checks

fix: revert timestamp change

In practice, this situation is unlikely to happen, since the timestamp
is set before mining begins. Setting it to the parent timestamp + 1
causes problems in some tests that rely on quickly producing blocks.

test: fix `idle_tenure_extend_active_mining`

Removes flakiness from blocks mining too quickly.
refactor: use `div_ceil` in idle time calculation

prs.title: feat: avoid clearing caches when block is successfully mined
prs.truncated_body: This further improves the mempool iteration by avoiding unnecessary resets of the mempool caches. When the block is mined successfully, then the caches are correct and can be kept intact for the building of the next block. My experiments show an additional 10% improvement in the time to process large mempools with this change.

commits.message: feat: avoid clearing caches when block is successfully mined
test: verify nonce cache in integration test

prs.title: ci: reduce test flakiness (CI is so slow)
prs.truncated_body: I noticed that sometimes the miner's 5 seconds runs out before it has time to include 5000 transactions in the block, triggering a failure.

prs.title: chore: cherry-pick fix NPE when using records
prs.truncated_body: Cherry-pick https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-consensus-node/pull/18664

prs.title: chore: fix NPE when using records
prs.truncated_body:
Since `boundaryStateChangeListener.lastConsensusTime()` will be set only when streamMode is Blocks or Both or once user transactions are handled, in Solo environments using `streamMode=RECORDS` will fail with NPE.

Delay dispatching node rewards until atleast one user transaction is handled

commits.message:
fix NPE when using records

Signed-off-by: Neeharika-Sompalli <neeharika.sompalli@swirldslabs.com>

The JRS test panels and the HAPI time consuming tests have been running in the XTS tests for about 6 months now with a lot of consistency. I would like to propose removing them from the pull request checks as they are run every

commits.message:
chore: Remove JRS Panels from PR checks

**Description**:
Remove Abbreviated JRS Panel and Hedera Node JRS Panel from PR checks

**Background**:
The JRS test panel has been running in the XTS tests for about 6 months now with a lot of consistency. I would like to propose removing them from the pull request checks as they are run every time a PR is merged to main.

**Related Issue(s)**:

Closes #18676

prs.title: fix: Also archive config.txt as part of network archiving process
prs.truncated_body:
In cases where `forceUseOfConfigAddressBook` is still enabled, the `config.txt` file must be archived in order to avoid an ISS on node restarts. This PR fulfills this requirement via moving `config.txt` from the node's working directory to the `data/config/.archive` directory with the other archived network files. 

Closes #18270

commits.message:
Also archive config.txt as part of network archiving process

Permit override network to return empty

Merge with main

prs.title: Support legacy Transaction in block stream
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR adds support of legacy Transaction in block stream

- Get transaction id from transaction body parsed from `Transaction.bodyBytes` if set 
- Support transaction hash calculation when `Transaction.bodyBytes` and `Transaction.sigMap` are set

**Related issue(s)**:

Fixes #10552

**Notes for reviewer**:

The other combinations of deprecated fields will get rejec

commits.message:
support legacy Transaction with bodyBytes and sigMap set

Merge branch 'main' into 10552-transform-block-transactions-without-signed-transaction-bytes

prs.title: Add evm version 51 support for hedera account service
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR add support for evm version 51 for modularized.
Adds support for HederaAccountService.

`EvmConfiguration` - add default evm version to 0.51 from 0.50
`MirrorNodeEvmProperties` - update evm versions map for mainnet.
`ContractCallHASSystemContractTest` - basic tests to verify HAS calls

Fixes #10115

**Checklist**

- [ ] Documented (Code comments, README, etc.

commits.message:
Add evm version 51, hedera account service
